science.author: Devorah Lev-Tov
science.title: The Death of the Plastic Straw
science.description: It's a growing trend: Hotels, resorts, safaris, and cruises are increasingly banning plastic straws.

science.author: Christina Nunez
science.title: This Machine Transforms Waste Into Walls
science.description: The portable Trashpresso is turning trash into building supplies.

science.title: What Happens to the Plastic We Throw Out
science.description: How a piece of trash can travel from land to Henderson Island, an uninhabited, remote island in the middle of the South Pacific Ocean.

science.author: Alexandra Genova
science.title: Along These Shifting Borders, Life is Full of Unease and Adversity
science.description: For people near the borders of these Russian-supported separatist territories in Georgia, uncertainty is a constant struggle.

science.title: Experience an Air Safari Through Kenya
science.description: This safari both indulges and educates its guests.

science.title: Discover Moscow's Colorful Cathedrals and Striking Palaces
science.description: These iconic sites occupy the heart of the Russian nation.

science.author: Elaina Zachos
science.title: This Is the Age When Puppies Are the Cutest, According to Science
science.description: Puppies reach “peak cuteness” between six and eight weeks old, which could provide some insight into how dogs evolved alongside people.

science.author: Elaina Zachos
science.title: Can People Really Mistake a Bear for a Dog, as This Family Claims?
science.description: Obvious differences set wild animals apart from domesticated ones, but mix-ups happen more often than you might think.

science.author: Amy Rankin
science.title: A Tarantula Sheds its Skin in New Time-Lapse Video
science.description: This venomous, but docile, Mexican red-kneed tarantula can be seen molting over seven hours in just 40 seconds.

science.author: Nina Strochlic
science.title: This Is What Daily Life in North Korea Looks Like
science.description: In a country where behavior is tightly controlled, a photographer captures individuality on the streets and in the businesses of Pyongyang.

tech.author: Vlad Savov
tech.title: The Selfish Ledger is Google’s creepy concept for total data collection
tech.description: An internal video made in late 2016 by Nick Foster, the head of design at Google X, was obtained by The Verge. It offers a stunningly ambitious and unsettling look at how some at the company envision using user data in the future.

tech.author: Robbie Gonzalez
tech.title: The Physics—and Physicality—of Extreme Juggling
tech.description: The world's best numbers juggler can throw and catch 14 balls. Once. Has he reached juggling's limit?

tech.author: Rhett Allain
tech.title: Fun Ideas That Keep Kids Learning Even After School's Out
tech.description: Boredom is just the start of an adventure.

tech.author: Michael Calore
tech.title: 14 Essentials to Improve Your Bike Commute in the City
tech.description: Even if you’re not a cycling pro, this stuff will help you ride to work like one.

tech.author: Jessi Hempel
tech.title: What Happened to Internet.org, Facebook's Grand Plan to Wire the World?
tech.description: Five years ago Mark Zuckerberg debuted a bold vision of global internet. It didn’t go as planned—forcing Facebook to reckon with the limits of its own ambition.

tech.author: Aarian Marshall
tech.title: Is Tesla's Autopilot Safe? Finding Out Demands Better Data
tech.description: Elon Musk has made bold claims about his sort of self-driving feature’s saving lives, but the truth is far trickier, and harder to reach.

tech.author: Matt Simon
tech.title: The Complete History And Future of Robots
tech.description: Here's the WIRED guide to catch you up on everything you should know about robotics.

tech.author: Robert Wright
tech.title: Sam Harris and the Myth of Perfectly Rational Thought
tech.description: Sam Harris, the famous proponent of New Atheism is on a crusade against tribalism but seems oblivious to his own version of it.

tech.author: Garrett M. Graff
tech.title: 4 Key Takeaways From Mueller’s First Year—and What’s Next
tech.description: One year in, Robert Mueller’s investigation into Trump and Russia appears poised to connect all the pieces of the puzzle.

tech.author: Thuy Ong
tech.title: This fancy speaker features a hidden tech drawer and Qi charging
tech.description: This fancy speaker features a hidden charging drawer and ‘high fidelity sound’. Native Union claims its speaker is able to produce sound that’s “close to that of a real orchestra.”

tech.author: Vlad Savov
tech.title: YouTube Music and YouTube Premium announced as YouTube Red replacements
tech.description: Google’s new music subscription service and app, YouTube Music, and its premium YouTube membership have been announced and priced.

tech.author: Thomas Ricker
tech.title: Entire Nest ecosystem of smart home devices goes offline
tech.description: The as of yet unexplained issues affected the entire lineup of Nest devices, including thermostats, locks, cameras, doorbells, smoke detectors, and alarms. Importantly, the devices remained (mostly) operational, they just weren’t accessible by any means other…

tech.author: Sam Byford
tech.title: Here's the Avengers edition OnePlus 6
tech.description: The most ambitious crossover event in history

tech.author: Sam Byford
tech.title: Microsoft announces Xbox Adaptive Controller for players with disabilities
tech.description: Microsoft has announced the Xbox Adaptive Controller, an Xbox controller designed for people with disabilities. The device was leaked earlier this week. It has two large programmable buttons and 19...

tech.author: Rachel Becker
tech.title: Hawaii’s erupting volcano is still going, and now it’s a threat to passing planes too
tech.description: The Hawaiian Volcano Observatory warned pilots about the gigantic ash plume by changing the aviation color code to red — which means that an eruption hazardous to air travel is happening, or could happen soon. This morning, local time, the Hawaiian Volcano Ob…

tech.author: Adam Rogers
tech.title: Yanny vs. Laurel Means We'll All Die Alone
tech.description: When everyone’s brain makes a little world out of sensory input, and everyone’s world is just a little bit different, can you really know anyone?

tech.author: Klint Finley
tech.title: Senate Votes to Save Net Neutrality, but Hurdles Remain
tech.description: Three Republicans joined Democrats to pass a resolution that would restore rules against blocking or throttling content. But the measure faces a tougher challenge in the House.

tech.author: Vlad Savov
tech.title: OnePlus 6 announced with a glass back and a notched 6.3-inch display
tech.description: OnePlus has revealed its new flagship Android device, the OnePlus 6. It has a Snapdragon 845 processor, a notched 6.3-inch 19:9 OLED display, and a starting price of $529.

tech.author: Casey Newton
tech.title: The Verge’s new game show, Converge with Casey Newton, launches May 23rd
tech.description: Converge with Casey Newton is an interview game show podcast from The Verge. Here’s the trailer.

tech.author: Dieter Bohn
tech.title: How to get a great patina on your iPhone X leather case
tech.description: Apple’s iPhone X saddle brown leather case is a little too yellow out of the box. In this how-to, Dieter Bohn completely overthinks how to add a nice, dark patina to it.
